Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility has not had any incidents over the last 5-years that qualify as a Five-Year Accident History event.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
The emergency action plan documents what will take place in the event of an emergency. A chain of command is clearly outlined, responsibilities are stated for each group of employees, and an evacuation procedure is defined. Because the facility is a non-responding site, they have coordinated with the Mattoon Fire Department to be able to call them for emergency response in case of an ammonia release, as necessary.

Planned changes to improve safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]:
The facility has implemented the components of the Program Level 3 RMP and associated PSM program, which has resulted in improved safety at our facility. Some of these components include ammonia refrigeration system safety training, employee training, management of change procedures, standard and emergency operation procedures, incident investigation procedures, RMP compliance audits, etc. If it is determined that additional safety corrections are needed, they will be implemented in an expedited manner.

Incident Investigation [40 CFR Part 68.81]
The Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could have reasonably resulted in, an unintentional release of ammonia. These investigations are undertaken within 48 hours of the incident to identify the situation leading to the event, as well as to define any corrective actions implemented to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of five (5) years.

Employee Participation [40 CFR Part 68.83]
The Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility truly believes that PSM and accident prevention is a team effort. Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to information related to PSM and RMP implementation, including Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) information.

Hot Work Permit [40 CFR Part 68.85]
Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. requires issuance of a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near the covered process. 

Contractor Safety Program [40 CFR Part 68.87] 
Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. may hire contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and/or construction activities related to the ammonia refrigeration system. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out initially & annually thereafter. Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility has a policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractor's work with the ammonia refrigeration system. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of ammonia occur.

Mechanical Integrity [40 CFR Part 68.73]
The Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility carries out highly documented maintenance checks on the ammonia refrigeration system equipment to ensure proper operations. Process equipment examined by these checks includes, among others, pressure vessels, piping systems, pressure relief valves, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps. Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in applicable maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner. At least once every five (5) years a mechanical integrity inspection/review is conducted for the complete refrigeration system.

Management of Change [MOC] [40 CFR Part 68.75]
Written procedures are in place at the Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility to manage changes in ammonia refrigeration system technology, equipment, and procedures. Authorized employees whose job tasks are affected by an ammonia refrigeration system modification are promptly made aware of and offered training to deal with the modification. 

Pre-Startup Safety Review [PSSR] [40 CFR Part 68.77]
Pre-startup safety reviews are conducted any time the ammonia refrigeration system, or any of its components, are opened for repairs, tie-ins, or modifications. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating procedures, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

The facility is also subject to the OSHA PSM standard under 29 CFR 1910.119, as well as the EPCRA Section 302 and 311/312 notification/reporting requirements. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the accidental release prevention program that are in place at the facility.

Process Safety Information [40 CFR Part 68.65]
The Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment designs associated with the ammonia refrigeration system.

Process Hazard Analysis [40 CFR Part 68.67]
Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our ammonia refrigeration system are identified and controlled efficiently. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is What If Scenarios. The studies are undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in refrigeration engineering and process operations and are re-evaluated at a minimum of every five (5) years. Any findings related to the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) are addressed in a timely manner.

Written Operating Procedures [40 CFR Part 68.69]
For the purpose of safely conducting activities related to our ammonia refrigeration system, Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. Mattoon facility maintains written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation including startup, normal operations, emergency operations, normal shutdown, emergency shutdown, and pump out. The information is reviewed annually and is readily accessible to all operators who work with the ammonia refrigeration system. Annual certification of operating procedures is documented to indicate they are current and accurate.

This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures, and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68) for Bimbo Bakeries USAs Mattoon, Illinois facility.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
The Bimbo Bakeries USA, Inc. facility located in Mattoon, Illinois is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with our regulated ammonia refrigeration system. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of ammonia. If such a release does occur, we have coordinated with the Mattoon Fire Department and the Coles County LEPC for emergency response support.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
This facility is a processing plant used for the food manufacturing of bagels. The only Risk Management Program (RMP) regulated substance present is anhydrous ammonia, which is utilized as the primary cooling media in two (2) closed-loop ammonia refrigeration systems. The engine rooms are in close proximity and are managed by onsite personnel as one system through a PSM Program; for the purposes of this RMP, we are considering both closed-loop systems as one process.

Due to the size and characteristics of the onsite ammonia refrigeration, as well as Process Safety Management (PSM) applicability (>10,000 lbs.), this facility is covered under Program 3 of the RMP regulations.
